name: Dr. John H. Watson
description: Army doctor, companion to Holmes, narrator of the case. In Act I, he carries the diary, mediates between Holmes and the world, and begins to question his own perceptions.
background: Veteran of Afghanistan, physician, and chronicler of Holmes's cases. His medical eye is both a tool and a liability as the case gnaws at his sanity.
secrets_known: The diary’s sigils shift when his mind is strained.
He possesses a laudanum vial he may offer or conceal.
clues_provided: Medical insight into wound patterns and anatomical plausibility.
Subjective accounts of hallucinations, if Mind Stability is low.

name: Sherlock Holmes
description: Consulting detective whose intellect cuts through fog like a scalpel. In Act I, he teeters between brilliance and obsession as he charts the Ripper murders on his map.
background: Known to London’s underworld and its most powerful men, Holmes thrives on puzzles that graze the moral edge of the possible.
secrets_known: The sigils in the diary form a cross-like pattern over Whitechapel.
Points labeled Harper, Lamb, and Beadle are missing or suppressed.
He suspects a coordinated group rather than a lone killer.
clues_provided: Map deduction of sigils over Whitechapel.
The 'coach route' hypothesis linking murders and charity routes.

name: Inspector Frederick Abberline
description: Seasoned Yard inspector bearing the weight of institutional failure. He guards the line between public truth and buried truth.
background: Tangled in the politics of policing Whitechapel, his loyalties divide between justice and survival.

relationships.yard: bound by obligation, haunted by remorse

secrets_known: Some witness statements have been suppressed.
Rumors of a 'ghost ledger' used to bury sensitive evidence.
clues_provided: Access (or denial) to sealed evidence folders.
Confirmation of the masked coachman near Miller’s Court.

name: Tobias Greel
description: An anatomist at St. Bartholomew’s whose fascination with dissection stains his moral sensibilities.
background: Straddles the line between healer and academic voyeur, treating murder as misapplied anatomy.

relationships.lamb: borrowed surgical saw noted in ledger

secrets_known: A surgical saw was lent to a Mr. Lamb.
Wounds appear staged to mimic surgical skill.
clues_provided: Tool ledger tying instruments to individuals.
Diagram showing reversal of cut direction.

name: Finch
description: A sharp-eyed local familiar with Whitechapel’s hidden paths, often troubled by constables.
background: Survives by wits and intuition; has witnessed more than he admits.
secrets_known: Knows shortcut alleys used by a particular coach.
Has seen a crest matching the diary’s sigils.
clues_provided: A shortcut map of Whitechapel routes.
Testimony about coach movements near river stairs.
